title: Walmart Has the Nintendo Switch 2 Back In Stock
summary: The Nintendo Switch 2 bundle includes Mario Kart World -- save up to $30.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. After selling out just about everywhere, you can pick up the new Nintendo Switch 2 at Walmart. Available to the public back in June, the Nintendo Switch 2 quickly sold out with infrequent restocks throughout the months. However, ahead of the holidays, retailers, like Walmart, have the game console ready for purchase with prices starting at $449. Buy: Nintendo Switch 2 + 'Mario Kart World' at Walmart $499 However, if you’d like to with the Nintendo Switch 2 and Mario Kart World game (priced at $79) bundle , then it starts at $499 from the retailer. Aside from Walmart , the new gaming console is also available on Target and Amazon , but stock is very, very limited. Scroll down and buy the Nintendo Switch 2 : PREORDER Nintendo Switch 2 + 'Mario Kart World' Release date: June 5 Buy Now At Walmart $499 $499 Buy Now At Target $499.99 $499.99 Armed with a vivid and brilliant 7.9-inch LCD display with HDR (High Dynamic Range) support, the Nintendo Swi…

title: BLACKPINK’s JISOO Teases Mystery Duet Partner For New Solo Single ‘Eyes Closed’
summary: The K-pop superstar appears to be prepping her follow-up to this year's "Your Love" single.
body: BLACKPINK ‘s JISOO is getting ready to be back in your area. The K-pop superstar posted a tease of what Blinks think is her next single on Sunday (Oct. 5) in the form of an elegant poster in which she is depicted wearing a black leather dress, her long black hair cascading past her waist as a shadowy figure lurks in the background. Across the bottom of the image is the phrase that appears to be the title of her upcoming single, “Eyes Closed,” which is accompanied by another tantalizing tease in the caption, “a duet is near.” At press time no release date or additional information on who JISOO may be dueting with on the track was available. The new song would be JISOO’s first new solo material outside of the group since she dropped her debut solo EP, Amortage , in February on her own Blissoo/Warner Records imprint. The five-track collection featured the singles “Earthquake” and “Your Love,” as well as “Tears” and “Hugs & Kisses” and it reached No. 11 on the Billboard Top Album Sales chart, marking the singer’s first entry on that tally; “Earthquake” peaked at No. 47 on the Bill…

title: Taylor Swift Reveals How Mom Andrea Reacted to One of the Horniest ‘Life of a Showgirl’ Songs: ‘She Thinks [It’s] About Superstitions’
summary: Sometimes a double entendre is not that hard to figure out.
body: To be fair, Taylor Swift is a 35-year-old woman who is engaged to be married. Still, you have to imagine that if there was a family listening party for the singer’s just-released 12th studio album, The Life of a Showgirl , there must have some cheeks streaked red with embarrassment when track nine, “Wood,” popped up. Related Taylor Swift Sells 2.7 Million Copies of ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ on First Day of Release in U.S. Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ Video Is Finally Up on YouTube: Watch Bad Bunny Fires Back at 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Show Backlash in 'SNL' Monologue: Watch If somehow you haven’t yet heard what is widely being perceived as one of the LP’s several sweaty homages to Swift’s fiancé, NFL tight end Travis Kelce, then you’re missing out on such lusty lines as: “Forgive me, it sounds cocky/ He ah-matized me and opened my eyes/ Redwood tree, it ain’t hard to see/ His love was the key that opened my thighs.” Now we know exactly how Swift’s mother, Andrea, reacted to the news that “a hard rock is on the way.” In a chat with SiriusXM’s The Morning…

title: This Taylor Swift ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ x ‘Napoleon Dynamite’ Dance Edit Is Actually Perfect
summary: Somehow, Swift's 2025 single and Napoleon's dance 2004 break were meant to be.
body: Twenty years before Taylor Swift ‘s “The Fate of Ophelia” was recorded, a character named Napoleon Dynamite (Jon Heder) was leaning into his uniqueness with a magnificently awkward dance routine, as seen in a memorable scene from the 2004 coming-of-age comedy Napoleon Dynamite . His sweet moves were soundtracked by Jamiroquai’s “Canned Heat,” but anyone who hasn’t seen the movie — and who happens to stumble upon the fan-made “Ophelia” x Napoleon Dynamite mashup making the rounds — just might think the choreo was meant to be paired with Swift’s 2025 single instead. Because it’s actually perfect. Swift fan @betterspiritsprintco on Instagram posted the funny edit on Friday (Oct. 3), the release day of the pop star’s twelfth studio album, The Life of a Showgirl , which is already setting records ; as of press time on Sunday, the Instagram post has been liked by more than 63,000 Instagram accounts. Related Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ Video Is Finally Up on YouTube: Watch The video’s caption: “how it feels to listen to the fate of ophelia.” The comments s…
